# Copilot Instructions for MaisonMiaro Website

<!-- Use this file to provide workspace-specific custom instructions to Copilot. For more details, visit https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/copilot-customization#_use-a-githubcopilotinstructionsmd-file -->

## Project Overview

This is a professional e-commerce website for MaisonMiaro, a clothing brand owned by Jakob. The website features:

- Modern, clean design showcasing clothing items
- 3D model viewer for rendered clothing items
- Product catalog with filtering and search
- Shopping cart functionality
- User authentication and profiles
- Admin panel for product management
- Responsive design for mobile and desktop
- Future payment integration preparation

## Technology Stack

- **Frontend**: Next.js 15 with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, React
- **Backend**: Next.js API routes for backend functionality
- **3D Rendering**: Three.js/React Three Fiber for 3D clothing models
- **State Management**: React Context/Zustand for cart and user state
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with custom components
- **Database**: Preparation for future database integration

## Design Guidelines

- Use modern, minimalist design principles
- Implement a professional color scheme suitable for fashion
- Ensure mobile-first responsive design
- Focus on high-quality imagery and 3D model presentation
- Maintain clean, accessible UI/UX patterns

## Code Standards

- Use TypeScript for all components and utilities
- Follow Next.js App Router patterns
- Implement proper error boundaries and loading states
- Use server components where appropriate
- Follow React best practices and hooks patterns
- Maintain clean, documented code with proper typing

## File Structure

- `/src/app` - Next.js App Router pages and layouts
- `/src/components` - Reusable React components
- `/src/lib` - Utility functions and configurations
- `/src/types` - TypeScript type definitions
- `/public` - Static assets and images
- `/src/app/api` - Backend API routes

When implementing features, prioritize user experience, performance, and maintainability.
